title: WCAS EARTH 201-0-01 Earth Systems Revealed
class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Registration for laboratory section required

See Class Details for Important Registration Info

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Introduction to Physical Geology: The study of Earth materials and the physical, chemical and biological processes that shape the planet. Topics include minerals; sedimentary, igneous, and metamorphic rocks; the interior Earth, oceans, and atmosphere; solid Earth processes, such as volcanism, seismicity, and plate tectonics and their interactions with the atmosphere and hydrosphere to drive surface Earth processes, such as climate, weathering, and glaciation; geologic time; global change. Course includes mandatory field trip to Baraboo, WI. (The field trip to Baraboo, Wisconsin will take place May 20-22, 2016.)

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
This is a popular class that fills quickly. Preregistration is open to EPS majors and minors only. The remaining seats will be filled via the Google Form waitlist. You MUST complete this form in order to be considered for the course: http://goo.gl/forms/UZq9pHRpiM



The required field trip to Baraboo, Wisconsin will take place May 20-22 2016.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three 50-minute lectures, one 2-hr. lab and weekend field trip required.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Three in-class exams; laboratory exercises and quizzes; field trip report.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Earth: An Introduction to Physical Geology with MasteringGeology, 11th Edition
Tarbuck, Lutgens, and Tasa
ISBN-13: 978-0-321-81406-7
Publisher: Pearson
Copyright: 2014
Suggested retail price: $147.80

AND

Laboratory Manual in Physical Geology, 10th Edition
Busch and Tasa
ISBN: 9780321944511
Publisher: Pearson
Copyright: 2015
***This is a workbook with tear-away assignments, therefore you must buy a new copy, not a used one.
